data.title: Le Rideau Cramoisi
data.meta_description: Where high and low cease to be perceived as opposites
data.text: In 1929 André Breton tried his hand, together with Albert Valentin, at a screenplay based on Barbey d’Aurevilly’s short story Le Rideau cramoisi (The Crimson Curtain).Nothing came out of this project as they couldn’t find a producer. In 1953 Alexandre Astruc succeeded in making an adaptation of Le Rideau Cramoisi for Anatole Dauman’s company Argos Films. […]
